cyclone.name: CLAUDETTE
cyclone.current_location: about 320 mi ESE of Nantucket, Massachusetts
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating ENE then NE, moving well offshore of the U.S. East Coast toward the waters south-east of Nova Scotia/Newfoundland
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: No direct landfall – closest passage expected south-east of Nova Scotia, Canada

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Swells and fringe rain bands along the Mid-Atlantic coast; primary impact zone is offshore waters and Atlantic Canada
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusts 20–30 mph from outer gradient winds Monday night into early Tuesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None – storm is far offshore and parallel to coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to locally moderate showers (generally <1 inch) possible in outer rain bands
weather_observation.other_hazards: Long-period swells and rough seas likely to raise harbor wave action and complicate pilotage and lightering operations Monday night–Tuesday
